Package cse360assign2

Class SimpleList

  • java.lang.Object
    • cse360assign2.SimpleList
  • public class SimpleList
extends java.lang.Object
    Class: SimpleList
    The SimpleList class contains a private int array and a private int. The array stores the list and the count stores the current number of elements in the list. It has 10 methods including the base constructor. These include SimpleList(), add(int), remove(int), int count(), String toString(), int search(), append(int), int first(), int last(), and int size(). Note the add method and remove method have been changed see their respective JavaDoc comments.
    Since:
    2020-02-27
    Author:
    Ethan Gilchrist

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      SimpleList()
      Constructor: simpleList()
      The simpleList constructor initialize the list int array to 10 values and sets count to 0.

    • Constructor Detail

      • SimpleList

        public SimpleList()
        Constructor: simpleList()
        The simpleList constructor initialize the list int array to 10 values and sets count to 0.

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add​(int input)
        Method: add()
        The add method will add values to index 0 of the array. It moves all other integers in array over. If list is full, the list is increased in size by 50%. This means for example a list of size 10 would increase to a size of 15. Increments the count every time a value is added.
        Parameters:
        input - an integer value to add to the array

      • remove

        public void remove​(int input)
        Method: remove()
        The remove method will check if the parameter is in the list and remove it. If the value is repeated, it only removes the first instance. The other values in the list are shifted down. Count is also lowered. If the list has more than 25% empty spots, the size of the list is decremented by 25%. For example if a list of 10 has only 7 filled spots it will be decremented to a size of 8. Note the list can't be reduced to less than 1 entry.
        Parameters:
        input - an integer value to remove from the array

      • count

        public int count()
        Method: count()
        This getter method returns the current count value of the class object. The count value is the number of elements in the array max at 10.
        Returns:
        count the current number of elements in array

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Method: toString()
        This toString method converts the array to a string. The values are separated by a space where the last integer does not have a space after it.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        printList the list array as a string separated by spaces

      • search

        public int search​(int input)
        Method: search()
        The search method will traverse the array to find the first instance of an integer, and then return the index of it. If not in the list return -1.
        Parameters:
        input - an integer value to search for in the array
        Returns:
        searchIndex an integer representing the index of the desired element

      • append

        public void append​(int input)
        Method: append()
        The add method will append values to the last index of the array. Note this is the "count" index or the end of the list. If list is full, the list is increased in size by 50%. This means for example a list of size 10 would increase to a size of 15. Increments the count every time a value is added.
        Parameters:
        input - an integer value to append to the array

      • first

        public int first()
        Method: first()
        This getter method returns the first value of the class object array list. The first value is just the value at index 0. We either return this value or if the list is empty (count = 0) return -1.
        Returns:
        the first element of the array

      • last

        public int last()
        Method: last()
        This getter method returns the last value of the class object array list. The last value is just the value at index count-1. We either return this value or if the list is empty (count = 0) return -1.
        Returns:
        the last element of the array

      • size

        public int size()
        Method: size()
        This getter method returns the size of the class object array list. The size is always this.list.length. This tells the user how many spaces are open for input.
        Returns:
        the length of the array
